content: >http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/7959315.stm On the eve of pulling out of their area of operations over the last 8 years, the Brits are claiming to have done at least one thing very well. They've restored the airport at Basra to a state worthy of a new beginning. The Basra airport is the last post held by the Brit contingent in Iraq and they can take pride in their accomplishment. Perhaps after they leave the Iraqis will stop rocketing their 'new' airport.
